pullRequest.title: Add option --notty to spacewalk-ssh-push-init
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
When using a non-root user to perform spacewalk-ssh-push-init and setting sudo according to the documentation, running the spacewalk-ssh-push-init with the --register option, the bootstrap script will not work. It seems that the script used hangs. The root cause is that the bootstrap scripts, or rather sudo, will ask for the root password. The option --notty will add the ssh option -t. This will then give the administrator the possibility to enter the password.
GUI diff
No difference.
